title: History of The Rt Hon Gordon Brown - GOV.UK

quotes: announced, at the Gleneagles Summit in 2005, an agreement to support the world’s poorest countries and deal with climate change.
Gordon Brown became Prime Minister on 27 June 2007 after Tony Blair left office.
the world’s first ever Climate Change Act, which was implemented in autumn 2008.

In April 2009, he hosted the G20 Summit in London where world leaders pledged to make an additional $1.1 trillion available to help the world economy through the crisis and restore credit, growth and jobs.
British forces withdrew from the country at the end of April 2009.
in December 2009, he became the first Prime Minister for some considerable time to stay in a war zone when he stayed overnight in Kandahar, Afghanistan.
in December 2009, he attended the United Nations summit in Copenhagen.
An agreement was finally reached in February 2010 and the powers were passed to Northern Ireland’s government in the following April.

roles.title: Chancellor
quotes: It was during his time as Chancellor that he proposed to Sarah Macaulay and 7 months later they were married at their home in North Queensferry.

roles.title: Prime Minister
quotes: Gordon Brown became Prime Minister on 27 June 2007 after Tony Blair left office.
announced, at the Gleneagles Summit in 2005, an agreement to support the world’s poorest countries and deal with climate change.
they were married at their home in North Queensferry.

In April 2009, he hosted the G20 Summit in London where world leaders pledged to make an additional $1.1 trillion available to help the world economy through the crisis and restore credit, growth and jobs.
UK combat operations in Iraq, which had begun during his predecessor’s time in office, came to an end under Gordon Brown.
He regularly visited Iraq and Afghanistan and, in December 2009, he became the first Prime Minister for some considerable time to stay in a war zone when he stayed overnight in Kandahar, Afghanistan.
in December 2009, he became the first Prime Minister for some considerable time to stay in a war zone when he stayed overnight in Kandahar, Afghanistan.
in December 2009, he attended the United Nations summit in Copenhagen.
During his time in office, he worked with his Irish counterpart Brian Cowen to negotiate the devolution of policing and justice powers in Northern Ireland.
